title: `@OidcClientFilter` triggers several tokens in concurrency conditions ðŸ’£
body:
### Describe the bug

When the [rest client](https://quarkus.io/guides/security-openid-connect-client-reference#resteasy-client-oidc-filter) is used for the first time, or when the token is being refreshed, multiple concurrent calls cause multiple request to retrieve the token.

It happens when the concurrency could even come from : 
- outside of the application _(through concurrent REST/gRPC calls)_ during a burst period
- or from the application itself as well, when concurrent calls are made _(throughout a `Uni.join()`)_

### Expected behavior

The token be retrieved once and shared for all customer calls, like in no concurrency conditions

### Actual behavior

Each concurrent call triggers a token retrieval 

### How to Reproduce?

I made a [test-case](https://github.com/Dougniel/quarkus-rest-client-oidc-race-condition/blob/main/src/test/java/org/acme/GreetingResourceTest.java) that simulates concurrency from outside the application and from inside. The test fails as only one call is expected to the `/oauth2/token`


### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Darwin Kernel Version 23.5.0 arm64

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "21.0.2" 2024-01-16 LTS OpenJDK Runtime Environment Temurin-21.0.2+13 (build 21.0.2+13-LTS) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Temurin-21.0.2+13 (build 21.0.2+13-LTS, mixed mode)

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.11.0

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Maven 3.9.6

### Additional information

I had a look at [`TokensHelper.java`](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/main/extensions/oidc-client/runtime/src/main/java/io/quarkus/oidc/client/runtime/TokensHelper.java) and it seems that the problem is between the first call to get the token and the reply : subsequent clients calls subscribes the same `Uni<Tokens>` thought the filter and so, triggers again the call to get the token. 

So I made a [patch](https://github.com/Dougniel/quarkus-rest-client-oidc-race-condition/blob/f3e28fba42da3fda2edcdaa32752e304c2520e5f/src/main/java/org/acme/runtime/PatchedTokensHelper.java#L79) by doing a `.memorize()` on `Uni<Tokens>` before `prepareUni(Uni<Tokens> uni)` returns
